title: How to Create a Newsletter with Google Docs

steps.title: Open Google Docs.
steps.content: Open Google Docs. If you have not installed it yet, install it from the App Store (for iPhones/iPads) or install it from the Play Store (on Android).

steps.title: Start a blank document.
steps.content: Start a blank document. To do this, locate the "Start a New Document" section and click on Blank (it should be a white "sheet" of paper with a multicolored plus mark on it).

steps.title: Write a heading.
steps.content: Write a heading. It should read something like this: "(Website Name)'s Newsletter: (Date)". Experiment with fonts and colors to make the newsletter more interesting.

steps.title: Choose at least three or four topics to talk about in your newsletter and gather a few authors to speak in your newsletter.
steps.content: Choose at least three or four topics to talk about in your newsletter and gather a few authors to speak in your newsletter. Once you've done that, write down a few smaller headings underneath the main heading. Remember to include the title and author, and try to keep the topic "inside" your website!

steps.title: Add a closure on the bottom after you've written down everything you've wanted to write.
steps.content: Add a closure on the bottom after you've written down everything you've wanted to write. The closure should have your website's name and the current date (e.g. "The SuperWikiHow Newsletter, Monday, June the 1st," except you might want to add the year as well) in small text.

steps.title: Click File when online once you've finished the newsletter.
steps.content: Click File when online once you've finished the newsletter. Then locate the Publish to the Web button, and publish the newsletter by either Link (you must provide the link to the Newsletter on your site) or Embed (you must embed the provided code, most preferably by copying and pasting, into your website).

steps.title: Post the link to the Newsletter on your website, or embed it in.
steps.content: Post the link to the Newsletter on your website, or embed it in. Congratulations! You now have created a Newsletter with Google Docs.
